numbered_ace_sentences: 1. Some young adults communicate with their parents at least once a week.
2. Among these young adults, young women communicate with their parents more often than young men.
3. Young women text their parents nearly 25% more frequently than young men.
4. Young women are more likely to maintain contact with their parents than young men.
5. Cultural norms about family connections differ between countries.
6. These trends might vary by country.
7. It would be useful to explore these trends in different countries.
8. It would be useful to examine this behavior in older age groups.
9. One older age group is the age group from 35 years to 40 years.
10. Mothers sometimes initiate contact with their children.
11. Fathers sometimes initiate contact with their children.
12. It would be useful to measure how often mothers initiate contact with their children.
13. It would be useful to measure how often fathers initiate contact with their children.
15. I find it hard to keep regular contact with my parents.
16. I try to contact my parents once every month.
17. The headline is: Staying in Touch.
